doc.after: In 1808 Bavarian educational commissioner Friedrich Immanuel Niethammer coined the term Humanismus to describe the new classical curriculum he planned to offer in German secondary schools 12 and by 1836 the word humanism had been absorbed into the English language in this sense The coinage gained universal acceptance in 1856 when German historian and philologist Georg Voigt used humanism to describe Renaissance humanism the movement that flourished in the Italian Renaissance to revive classical learning a use which won wide acceptance among historians in many nations especially Italy 13
